snippet.title: A.P.B (Amiga) Days 1 - 12
snippet.description:
Bizarrely, I couldn't find any videos of an even remotely decent play of APB,  (All Points Bulletin), one of my favourite computer games back when I was a teenager, so I thought I'd give it a quick go. I loved the open world style of the game. You can drive anywhere within the time limit and keep getting donuts to get more time. I used to drive around just picking up money bags.

People often talk about difficult 'retro games' and usually mention things like Contra (which is only ten minutes long and not really difficult at all) or Ghouls 'n Ghosts, but none of them come close to this game. I genuinely don't think anyone could complete this game without the use of cheats or save states, and the Amiga version is considerably easier than the Atari ST version (I'll upload a play of that version shortly).

I will update this video as and when I record a better play of it.
